section.p: ‘Were you set ashore by your fellow crewmen?’ you ask the poor wretch, for this is a common punishment at sea.

‘No,’ he says. ‘We had the misfortune to encounter a shoal of mermaids. Hearing their sad sweet song, all the others flung themselves into the sea and were drowned. Later the ship hit that reef and sank, and there I waited till you found me.’
‘Why didn’t the mermaids’ song affect you?’
He gives a wry smile. ‘I’m tone deaf.’
